title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A traditional Italian pasta dish featuring rich, creamy sauce made with eggs, Pecorino Romano, and crispy pancetta, all perfectly seasoned with black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, cut pancetta into small cubes and fry in a large pan until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add pasta to the pan with pancetta.
Remove pan from heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture, tossing rapidly to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
Add pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Tender chunks of grilled chicken cooked in a rich, creamy, and aromatic tomato-based sauce infused with a blend of Indian spices.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and half of the spices for at least 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute. Add remaining spices and cook for another minute.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in cream and cooked chicken. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with naan bread or rice.

title: Bibimbap
summary: A popular Korean dish consisting of a bowl of warm white rice topped with sautéed vegetables, a fried egg, sliced meat, and gochujang (Korean chili paste).
instructions: Cook rice and set aside. Sauté beef in a pan with soy sauce, garlic, and sugar until cooked.
Sauté the carrot and zucchini separately in sesame oil until tender.
Blanch the spinach and season with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Fry an egg sunny-side up.
In a bowl, arrange rice, beef, vegetables, and egg. Add gochujang on top.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately, mixing all ingredients before eating.

title: Tagine of Lamb with Prunes
summary: A slow-cooked Moroccan dish made with tender lamb, sweet prunes, and aromatic spices, served with couscous or flatbread.
ingredients: Almonds and sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a tagine or heavy pot and brown the lamb on all sides.
Add chopped onions and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in cinnamon, ginger, turmeric, and cumin, cooking for another minute.
Add prunes, honey, and stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until lamb is tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro, toasted almonds, and sesame seeds. Serve with couscous or flatbread.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: A simple yet delicious Italian pizza topped with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil leaves, drizzled with olive oil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°C (480°F).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Top with sliced tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven, top with fresh basil leaves, and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
